document.docAuthor: Huang, Jia, Gong, Lu, Tsaur, Shun-Chern, Zhu, Lin, An, Keying & Chen, Hongwei
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the subgenus Phortica (sensu stricto) (Diptera, Drosophilidae) from East Asia, with assessment of species delimitation using DNA barcodes

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the subgenus Phortica (sensu stricto) (Diptera, Drosophilidae) from East Asia, with assessment of species delimitation using DNA barcodes

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Amiota ( Phortica ) omega
Okada, 1977: 21
;
Chen & Toda 1998: 404
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. This species is very similar to
P . perforcipata
MÃ¡ca, 1993
in the male terminalia and having the abdominal sixth tergite with 1 distinct, prickly process on anterior corner of lateral margin ( Fig. 22A ), but can be distinguished from the latter by having the posterior branch of paramere slender, narrower than anterior branch, and the anterior branch slightly expanded subapically ( Fig. 22D ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 21.
Phortica ( Phortica ) okadai ( MÃ¡ca, 1977 )
from Guanmenshan Forest Park, Liaoning, China, male. A. Epandrium, surstylus, and cercus (lateral view); B. Surstylus (frontal view); C. Hypandrium, paramere, aedeagus, gonopod, and aedeagal apodeme (lateral view). Scale bars = 0.1 mm.
